repnme.cdata!:
Bangladesh - Second Small Scale Flood
            Control, Drainage and Irrigation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Second Small Scale Flood
            Control, Drainage and Irrigation Project in Bangladesh are
            as follows: overall outcome of the project was rated
            satisfactory, performance of the Bank was rated
            satisfactory, and the performance of the Borrower was rated
            unsatisfactory. Lessons learned from the project are: i)
            land acquisition compensations should be fair and based on
            market studies of prevailing land values and the land
            acquisition system itself ought to be carefully planned and
            the bureaucratic process should be initiated before project
            appraisal or negotiations; (ii) while the situation has now
            improved, counterpart funding was initially an issue
            impeding project implementation. More careful appraisal of
            expected funding levels should be undertaken to adjust
            project size to likely budget constraints; (iii) the
            Operation Status Survey (OSS), conducted on over 250
            subprojects completed under the 1979 project and this
            project, indicated that, with the exception of recently
            completed works, embankments and hydraulic structures are in
            a state of disrepair due to faulty operation and delayed
            maintenance. As agreed, Government of Bangladesh (GOB)
            should take urgent action, using its own funds, to remedy
            these defects; and (iv) participatory Operation and
            Maintenance (O&M) practices, demonstrated on a pilot
            basis under this project, should be introduced on a wider
            scale. The International Development Association (IDA), GOB
            and Bangladesh Water Development Board (BWDB) management
            should improve monitoring of progress of O&M and timely
            remedies and actions taken to resolve emerging issues.

docna.cdata!:
Bangladesh - Ssecond Small Scale Flood
            Control Drainage And Irrigation Project : Credit 1870 -
            Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Bangladesh - Ssecond Small Scale
            Flood Control Drainage And Irrigation Project : Credit 1870

repnme.cdata!:
Bangladesh - Second Small Scale Flood
            Control, Drainage and Irrigation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
In an attempt to protect agricultural
            land against floods; improve drainage; provide water for
            irrigation; and strengthen the capacity of BWDB, this Second
            Small Scale Flood Control, Drainage and Irrigation Project
            comprises two components.  They entail (a) construction of
            small scale flood control, drainage and irrigation
            subprojects; and (b) rehabilitation of infrastructure
            damaged or destroyed during the 1987 floods. Specifically,
            the project includes:  (a) construction of permanent water
            control structures in about 200 small subprojects; (b)
            construction of about 15 new subprojects requiring both
            earthworks and structures; (c) procurement of vehicles and
            equipment; and (d) provision of technical assistance and
            training to assist BWDB in institution building.  Under this
            project the World Food Programme (WFP) intends to provide
            food in exchange for work to be carried out under specific
            project activities.  Subprojects are to be selected during
            project implementation in accordance with guidelines agreed
            during negotiations.
